headline.main: Measuring Up; New Front in the Battle of the Bulge

docs.abstract: Greg Critser comment on France's new National Sizing Campaign, which updates clothing sizes so they bear closer resemblance to today's slightly fuller French figure; photo; French are eating more like Americans, which has doubled child obesity rates, but they also have good eating habits instilled by 'puericulture,' century-old movement promoting childhood well-being (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: THE French are measuring themselves. And the French government is paying for it. The country's new National Sizing Campaign represents the figure- and fashion-conscious nation's attempt to update clothing sizes so they bear a closer resemblance to today's slightly fuller French figure. Emphasis on slightly: the obesity rate in France has now topped 10 percent. The rate in the United States is three times that.
